args.natural_language_statement:
Prove that in a metric space, S is closed if and only if every sequence in S that converges in X has its limit in S.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Set Filter
open Metric

/-- Prove that in a metric space, S is closed if and only if every sequence in S that converges in X has its limit in S. -/
theorem isClosed_iff_tendsto_ext {S : Set X} [MetricSpace X] :
    IsClosed S â†” âˆ€ (a : â„• â†’ X) (l : X), (âˆ€ n, a n âˆˆ S) â†’ Tendsto a atTop (ğ“ l) â†’ l âˆˆ S := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib
open Set Filter

/-- In a metric space, S is closed iff every sequence in S that converges in X has its limit in S. -/
theorem isClosed_iff_seq_tendsto_mem {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] {S : Set X} :
  IsClosed S â†” âˆ€ (a : â„• â†’ X) (l : X), (âˆ€ n, a n âˆˆ S) â†’ Tendsto a atTop (ğ“ l) â†’ l âˆˆ S := by sorry
